page.title: 05Clay Hill Farm
page.content: {Jack Connah's Farm}is a small farm . Jack's main job on the farm is delivering milk which he starts to deliver at{5.45 a.m..}His wife and one of his sons help drive the floats and deliver the milk.The milk arrives at the farm by an Express milk lorry. It arrives about{3.26 a.m.}every day and is unloaded into the fridges. In the winter Jack does a double round on a Saturday. They have two rounds to complete. One round is eight miles long and the other six. They have four floats which they use to deliver the milk. There are two Express milkmen in the whole of Shotton and Mancot. Jack delivers to many places such as Nursing Homes,shops and building firms. He delivers round Sandycroft, Mancot, Sealand, Queensferry and Pentre . He collects payment most days of the week but mainly at the weekend.
